text: The Jurchens were a Tungusic people who lived in Manchuria in present-day Northeast China.Twitchett, Herbert Franke et al. (1994). The Cambridge History of China: Alien Regimes and Border States, p. 216. They were known as Jurchens until the 17th century when they became known as the Manchu. The Jurchens established the Jin Dynasty.Holcombe, Charles. (2011). A History of East Asia : from the Origins of Civilization to the Twenty-first Century, p. 129. The Jurchen Wanyan Yingge's paternal nephew Wanyan Wuyashu however fought against the Koreans, forcing them to submit and recognize Jurchens as overlords after "pacifying" the border between the Koreans and Jurchens. The Joseon Dynasty of Korea placed great value on a policy of "neighborly relations" (gyorin or kyorin) with the Jurchen people.Chun-gil Kim The History of Korea, pp. 76-77. == References == Category:History of China Category:Ethnic groups in China
title: Jurchen people
